iuY-z_NfibRgmK2luJYXjQ.text: Yum!!! I am so so glad they opened a hazelnuts right in Blakeney! I haven't had a single thing that I didn't like. Our current favorites are the curry chicken, the thai chicken, and the maple dream but next time we go, I'm trying something on the veggie side. It's a simple concept and they execute it perfectly! Don't be afraid to ask for things on the side (like maple syrup). The service is excellent too with really friendly staff and a clean and quaint sitting area.

iQ7JL70XnivimwMn-aScgA.text: Thank you for opening up in Blakeney! We went there on Saturday for brunch recently with our son and I had a wonderful experience. We had to wait for 10 minutes for a table to open up but our server was so accomodating. He found a table that was comfortable for our family and was so apologetic for us waiting. The food is delicious and the staff is attentive. We would definitely go back again and I would definitely bring out of town family here for brunch!

sLftSjrxj_o3wrfMjwEP_w.text: Love love love their crepes! The employees are friendly, the restaurant is clean and the crepes are delicious. Minor detail but they have awesome ice cubes, the soft, sonic type. Yum!

T0qm6mNISy33-gltkzedhw.text: Oh my goodness....can you say delicious! What a treat that we now have a location nearby! Crepes sweet or savory are so yummy!

Jctdg_pM3AyW3X7aGcJuqw.text: My new favorite fast food place. Delicious crepes!  Huge selection! Friendly staff. Did I mention the crepes are delicious!  Great price!  Food quality of much more expensive crepe restaurants.

m4SnMMMvxvVgpfrTS6hEkQ.text: Crepes were amazing. Very busy place on a Sunday with limited seating. Really excellent crepes. We had two different types of crepes, then we split a dessert crepe. They are pricey but they all taste great. You order at the counter and pick them up.

0mJSYNZxYf2mFVtn9K5oLw.text: The GOAT of creperies, the chicken crepe was insane and the smores one was the best dessert I've ever had. Definitely will be back.

CrqVyzYeLzxMQpGZN29NAQ.text: Went in this morning and I have to say this will be my new breakfast spot on Sunday mornings. My hazelnut banana crepe was delicious and my coffee was great , and I'm picky about my coffee. Stop by you won't regret it.

lpzub6CYvhAXSpN74zRFAQ.text: I'm a huge fan!!!!  Definitely need to go here for their breakfast and lunch options!  I've been here multiple times, each time with new friends.  Everyone has left a big fan with plans to come back!  Keep it up!!!!

OSzXRl9rIEAY0KN6MD8Trg.text: So glad to have given this a try.  Wonderful selection of sweet and savory crepes.  Breakfast crepes served all day.  There are also a good vegetarian crepes and salads.  I had the Pesto Capri which was packed with fresh veggies and the crepe texture was perfect.  My daughter had The Catalina which tasted amazing and contained generous ingredients.  I'll be back.

YS4KMhIh9vIO8asz4erBKw.text: Awesome crepes both savory and sweet, great new spot in Blakeney Shopping center!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

gdoYE4VpXej0h9KJHrLOBg.text: Fantastic, beautiful crepes.. we 3 shared a banana split crepe and it was awesome and not too sweet. Can't wait to come back for savory and breakfast crepes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing Banana Split Crepe!
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

CnDu25mIvpRSs-u3thbBNw.text: I had a buffalo chicken crepe.  The crepe was crispy on the outside and packed with fillings- chicken lettuce blue cheese hot sauce. Very tasty.  I was starving so i wanted something with protein, I will try a sweet one next time.  Lots of Nutella choices.  Very clean and had nice kids working there

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken crepe

hpUtsaZDOwKDC8rojwyRcA.text: Just come back from a delightful brunch. The crepes were excellent... enjoyed every bite.. We certainly recommend this restaurant!!!!

8jVU3nbF-zDRS4hU9QNDVw.text: This is my children's favorite brunch spot on the weekends! It's fast and filling but not too heavy. They go for the sweet ones but I go for savory bfast. Every single thing on the menu is delicious!

pyrV_OAtPhoJMFRA-2_xBQ.text: Great options for both savory and sweet crepes. My friend and I got one of each and split both. Sooooo yummy. We got the Catalina and the Creme de la Crepe. I recommend both.

bNngmlpEUPSrP3XphgaKSw.text: Great portion sizes, big enough to share! Do wish they'd use real plates rather than paper. This was our 2nd trip and we'll definitely be back!

Mi5E7Pa96Yz8a4mOYcd8jA.text: We've been 3 times now and has been excellent every time. We've had the S'mores and the Banana Split. Both were incredible but the S'mores was just simply awesome. Hey have a wide variety to choose from including savory food crepes. But we love the dessert ones.  They are big enough to split and at $10, makes sense to do as well.   We will be going back often. Service all 3 times has been great.

-z-7wNOK8ga7DpG8O2kRiw.text: I can't put my finger on it but I was not impressed by this place.  It just doesn't seem like a friendly place that appreciates its customers. I ordered two crepes recently. The food is ok. Overall: MEH!

lFFyIleT880AjsAQTsJVbg.text: I love their crepes.  I'm addicted!  The breakfast and dessert crepes are my favorite but it is so hard to choose.  Keep up the good work and the great customer service.

4kpf70AcO8J6JRyxdm0HWw.text: Charlotte gem opens up another location, and South Charlotte wins!  The local owners bring a much-needed unique and delicious option to those of us pining for something more than just 'getting by' in over-franchised suburbia.  This is like the Viva Chicken of breakfast/brunch -- it never gets old, the menu is deeeeeep in goodness and the service is great.    They have completely aced the recipe for the crepes that are the backbone of the menu, and have a very well-thought out variety of savory and sweet options that hit a broad cross section of tastes. Crepes aren't quick and they're easily botched, but these folks have their recipe and their process down pat so that the wait times are fine, the quality is high and highly consistent ... it's a reasonable price point that is well worth the hand-crafted treat for your mouth and your tummy (yes, the savory varieties are filling).  I only hope the owners are already looking for more space (or maybe an additional nearby location), because I predict this place is going to get overrun!

khICKeTU-1GCSQRkYzpTVQ.text: The crepes here were sooooo good. My wife had the buffalo chicken, while I had the smoked BLT. Super fantastic! After eating every last bite we couldn't resist one more for dessert. The banana berry cinn was the perfect way to finish off the meal. Glad Hazelnuts just opened up in Blakeney, since we're here almost every day! Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

7Z1vSZgDcbRZL5860hTnFg.text: This is the new fav place for me and my Family!  U cannot go wrong with any item on the menu. Everything is made top quality and fresh. The whole staff is friendly and kind. Each time we have been here, I noticed Aaron goes out of his way to make sure each and every customer is happy. I would rate this 10 star out if 5!!

hMeKt9NXro5iXvUjwTGy8Q.text: Excellent!! Excellent!! Crepes!! I found this new restaurant on Yelp, a few weeks ago and decided to give it a try.  Definitely worth trying!!! The restaurant is very nicely set up. There isn't much seating which makes me wonder how are they going to accommodate the masses!! The ambience of the restaurant is great food meets efficiency!!  Will definitely be coming back!! Excellent restaurant for children too.

EMojLbqqJHZWhOnsfkBUjA.text: The people that work there are super friendly and I love the crepes! I always get the s'mores! It's a really fun place and a fun twist on traditional crepes!

mkiKoP5SmqQbQGKgGF2Lfw.text: Wow!!!! Such a great find! They've been there about 2 months and I believe they will be there for years to come.  My friend and I stopped in one Friday night looking to satisfy a evening snack and sweet tooth.  We opted for the chicken pesto crepe (minus goat cheese) and the cream de le crepe (strawberries, Nutella, whipped cream).  Both were AMAZING!! We thought we would be able to share and ended up going back to order seconds of the chicken pesto! The staff were extra friendly and the price is reasonable (~$7.50-$8.50) for the amount and quality of food received. If you're ever in the area, I highly recommend stopping in to give them a try!

1oC1BVD-ZwUVeKfYfbA9TQ.text: I had the Mexican crepe. Wonderful place in the Blakeney area. Friendly staff and fast service.

bNpWVbKemTRi_nZAv9JQGQ.text: Not anywhere as good as the uptown locations which I love. Service was SLOW and food was mediocre at best.

XCLHCNGJZF3JL_o6Bt88Sw.text: I really wanted to like this place, especially with all the great reviews.... But the service left something (a lot) to be desired.  This is not a big restaurant, at all. So to walk in and not have a single staff either acknowledge you or  direct you to where to order, sets the tone.  As it was our first time, we asked for recommendations, not sure why that was so difficult. The staff had no recommendations, just the blanket, "everything is good" response. That answer always makes me worried, how to you work somewhere and have no opinion?   We settled on the Americana and the samosa. The samosa was tasty, the Americana had processed turkey meat (like the rounds from the plastic packages at Walmart.) Not what you would expect for $9....I mean at least go to the deli and get shaved turkey meat.  The food was good, the service was not. Overall, an unsatisfactory experience.   I do not recommend this pace and I would not go back.

kYv-9L99BbqFBdEQYQ1ArA.text: When we walked in, the staff wasnt responsive.  There was no "welcome" or "how are you."  Then when it came time to order, there were no recommendations, just a blank stare from behind the counter.  The food was good.  I ordered the Americana and my wife the samosa.  I was surprise that the meat they used for my Americana was deli meat not cooked in store. The prices were also very shocking. I can't understand how they justifiably  came up with those price points especially when nothing is made in house.  It was a okay experience.  I don't think I'll be back here for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front counter

J5xz8hhDi3oNPUGIP5CPVw.text: Tried this place out today. I have never had a crepe before today and boy was it delicious. I had the Jalapeno Chicken and my girlfriend had the Pesto Capri crepe. Both were so good and the prices are very reasonable for these filling crepes. The place is very simple and tasteful, and the staff is very friendly. Will come back and recommend!

3Qzv-oQ8AGGrka3oYCaFvw.text: The food isn't too bad. Went here because the hubby wanted to try it. I guess my only complaint is that there is no changing table in the bathroom. I had to change my daughter on the floor. I'm glad I had a mat to lay her on.

p_unsn0x8nbzXANogLXKFA.text: We've been coming for months, most Saturday mornings. Kids crepe at almost $6 is a bit high for what they get but the quality is good. I'm afraid we pay for the novelty of it, which is a concern for their future - because we like it very much. Unfortunately, their coffee isn't very good (or fresh, or promoted) or else we'd come much more often. I think they would do very well with some packages, like including a soda/juice with a kids crepe, for $.50 more, instead of offering everything a la carte. Same with the coffee - if the coffee was paid attention to and there was a "crepe and coffee" special, I'd jump at it most mornings. I don't know what goes on here during lunch, I've never been. It might is amazing. Again, the quality is really good and fresh ingredients, so it's probably good. The kids really like it here.

ubxc4JauyYS0xZio2kKl3w.text: Best crepes ever. Great for vegetarians with an entire section of options. We tried the crepe samosa and it was delicious and ordered other regular breakfast crepes and everything was good. Would recommend this place. A very small detail that I didn't like was thier cheap disposable plates which could be easily replaced with something better.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crepe samosa
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

G_PYoe3nV5BSv_N2m5-1Qg.text: A must stop if YOU are in this area. We got sweet crepes with Nutella, fresh fruits and ice cream. Tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

5j1bHSu4k6uWgscbnp1kug.text: I am glad that blakney has another restaurant to eat at. It needed it. The crepes were good. I got the berry delight and it was delicious. My only issue with the place is the seating situation. It is a small restaurant so they don't have a lot of space to work with. The employees were constantly sliding tables around to accommodate the patrons coming in. We were asked to move our seats and slide our table to one side and the other as people came and left. The tables were practically right on top of each other so when it is busy you feel like you are sitting really close to the people next to you. It was chaotic to say the least. I enjoyed the food and the style of the restaurant was nice, but this is not a good place to bring groups. 2-4 people tops! It is way too small and too busy for more than that. I felt like I had to eat and get up fast because there were lots of people waiting for us to leave so they could sit down. Overall, I would come here again. I thought the food and the price was good. I just really hope they figure out a better seating situation so the dining experience could be more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Berry delight crepe
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

mkUTPtUbELX7fkDpnGJvDA.text: My fiance and I started with the curry chicken and chipotle chicken and they were SO GOOD that we decided we needed the s'more crepe too. I'm already looking forward to coming again

8IoQn3FgY3qTqFq89RYa7w.text: Great little creperie! Fast, friendly service. Nice menu selection. Very clean and it has a nice atmosphere.

2klXDRYD2pJA6cNdaUtg0g.text: Awesome place! With great customer service. We tried the peanut butter and cheddar crepe. It sounds weird but it was soooooo delicious! The vegan options are amazing as well.

OBmevhL-vSzgbv9nC0fN7A.text: Great little crepe place! It was a small little crepe place that was very nice to have a crepe. Staff was friendly and they had some unusual crepe which I did not think I would like but I did. I had a chicken bacon ranch crepe which was absolutely delicious.

PHxqui_17tA6rCr7_YKiqA.text: Just had the basil pesto chicken and it was amazing! All the ingredients for very evenly spaced out too, which was a nice change from some other places I have been

fIXr0Wz8KXbw1eWBkmncDg.text: Very yummy.    Little girl and I had the banana split crepe and it was perfect for the two of us to split.  Nice place to visit if you are shopping in the area and need some food, something different.

7gF8U2-HPlCx9qTEab07Pw.text: If you are looking for a small town feel and a big town this is the place. Yes the seating area is small but fantastic for food on the go. This is not your costco, Walmart size place. There is an Ihop down the road Chelsea C they can accommodate you.  I haven't tried all of the varieties but plan too each time I return. You guys rock!!!

f_q6pNHYzQ2t7fkbyViR_w.text: I'm impress with how crispy the crepe is. Drinking hot tea and crepe is one of the best combo when it's cold and raining. Went there two weeks ago and will try other kind of crepes next time

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smore crepe and herbal tea

ZBKW2uyG9lzATBNk_MQeRw.text: One of our new favorite spots. Everything on the menu is definitely worth trying but our favorites are the Smoked BLT, the Chicken Bacon Ranch and the s'mores crepe. Very good portion size and reasonable prices.

GcbkhFGsoo0yX0jKA8cOyQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Customer service is wonderful and welcoming. Would a great spot for a quick dinner or a delicious treat. I enjoyed the Basil pesto chicken while shopping, but they offer many fruit filled selections as well! Do yourself a favor & stop by when you are in the area, you'll be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

-wif1q3FkEhuKKWVSTwlzA.text: Love this addition to south Charlotte! You can choose from breakfast, savory or sweet crepes and there are vegetarian options too.  We ordered the chipotle chicken crepe and the creme de la crepe (strawberries and nutella).  Both were delicious but my favorite was definitely the sweet crepe. We added a scoop of vanilla ice cream - yum!

tDAJ_wyLRa3KoES3EXNXHg.text: Nestled by the side, this place is worth a try, especially for their chicken curry crepes. Loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken curry crepe
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

0K5dHFDOYqKenQw3vMmq4Q.text: I love this place! Here's why: They listen. I have been several times, and they have crepes that range from sweet to savory. There are "breakfast" options with eggs, "lunch" items with chicken pesto and "dessert" crepes with lemon, etc. I have always had excellent service and food. My daughter has a slight allergy to hazelnut/nutella, so they leave that item off and give her extra whipped cream. Niccccce.   The listening part? When I first went there, I noticed there weren't any highchairs. This location is family-oriented and the bench seats do not have breaks in them. What that means is that kiddos can literally crawl from one end of the restaurant to the other. I like kids, I have two. But, I know their parents may freak out that their child can become an unexpected guest at someone else's table. By my next visit, I noticed highchairs. I'd like to think I was the catalyst for this, but the manager let me know that it was "in the works."  Also, I have never had a wrong order. That's something! The pagers will scare you senseless with how loud they are when they beep, but hey, at least you know your food's ready, right? This is just a "don't freak out" warning for those of you who are sound sensitive.  My advice: Try anything on the menu. It's all good. Over the last year or so, my friends and I have tried each thing and have not found a dud yet.  Enjoy!

igNq6-JMggVPNa5LxOx5fQ.text: Wow, been missing out! This place is delicious. Super clean and staff is friendly. You can come in for either breakfast, lunch, or dinner. My favorite was the chicken curry crepe (I ended up replacing it with tofu) and the flavor was just right. We had the Banana Nutella with a scoop of ice cream as dessert and it was perfect. Definitely a must try, will be recommending to all my friends and family for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Nutella Crepe
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hazelnut Iced Coffee with Cream
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Samosa Crepe

pROCQkkqAqHt1y81tT4PPg.text: Cute little modern venue with an excellent selection of crepes.  Our stop was just for a sweet snack.  We chose the Banana Split Crepe.  Very generous with the toppings which included ice cream and whipped cream.  It wasn't very crowded but there was plenty of staff on hand.  The dining area was very neat and clean.  Definitely a nice break spot after an afternoon exploring the Blakney shops that pleases the sweet tooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

YTQcwCCWcVOp2ESH-tR6WA.text: Nutella!!!!!! I am very happy to find this place! Very tasty:) Clean and simple. One of the evenings when we stopped by for a dessert - it wasn't 9, but they didn't let us inn. I am rating it with 5 stars, but would recommend the crepes to be made with more eggs, so they get more tasty (coming from Europe, I am picky about it). Overall - THE place for sweet end of the day.

Hfg4tIBHmRhmjeiM8OReZw.text: You cant go wrong at this place! The food was amazing. I just wish they used metal utensils instead of all plastic.

jt-GlVFsgncJqGBm9As1rg.text: Love this place! I went there first with my sister and again with my best friend because I love it so much. My favorite savory crepe is the Chicken Bacon Ranch and my favorite sweet crepe is the Creme de la Crepe because it is not too sweet and has strawberries and chocolate in it. If anyone else is indecisive like me, I would recommend getting one savory crepe as your "main meal" and then sharing a sweet crepe with a friend or family member. Ooooh did I mention they also have GLUTEN FREE!?!? I was so happy that my sister could enjoy this delicious food with me.

pYImkNty98YoxZYox6nJzA.text: I've been here multiple times.. and it's just honestly not that good. I get the Nutella crepe and each time it's overdone and hard. And not even close to enough Nutella?.. picture shows.  I must also note, I've never had any of the staff seem like they overly enjoy working there or enthusiastic about anything.   I'd rather just go to Cast Iron Waffles for a sweet treat

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nutella?
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nutella?

M5Luy8-MMeITTW64IZANTA.text: I was in the area and craving something sweet. This place came up on yelp and I decided to try it out. I was kind of full from lunch but still craving dessert so I tried the Lemon Drop Crepe. This was something light but so delicious. I really enjoyed the flavor! I don't live in Charlotte so I'm not sure if I'll be back to try other flavors but the experience I did have while here was very satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

yWPZ4t7c1IsPOhHWERb7nw.text: 1- staff not friendly 2- massive amount of powdered sugar on our ordered...  Local owner take of your business  Also do not wheel trash out of front door, young gentleman worker with glasses wheeling smelly trash out of front in between patrons eating on outside tables!! Seriously?  12:03 PM

TLPY6UDIQW1iWWW80_zpNw.text: I came here for the first time and ordered the chipotle chicken crepe it was light and delicious loved the aioli that was served with it. The ambiance is great casual clean and well lit. Service was prompt and efficient. The only con is the space is very small  but everything else was good

aCoPGl3Ou7DBWivL1SfmrA.text: Crepes are good but the service not so much. I would suggest going to the one on Johnston Road, much better service and the food is plated with a lot more attention to detail.

u-5P5GzjMS2ZGV0WFkcI0Q.text: This place is the go to for your crepe cravings!  I have been here three times and each time am more and more satisfied!  My favorite is the strawberry/Nutella one!  Highly recommended.  They also have my favorite orange Sanpellegrino!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

bPgfQxnvsoxFX0MnFsoHGA.text: location: conveniently near other stores and restaurants  parking: on weekends, terrible. you might have to park somewhere across the shopping center  ambience: casual, clean, brightly lit  service: friendly. you order at the counter first and wait for your buzzer to light up. probably only waited about 5 mins and the place was pretty busy.  food: good! hard to mess up a crepe but the ingredients seemed fresh and well-proportioned. I don't like a ton of stuff in my crepes so I ordered off the kids menu. the crepes are the same size. I got the one+one, mozz cheese+ egg. simple and classic. my friends enjoyed their savory ones as well. decently filling, but I could've gone for an additional desert crepe too.   notes: this place is pretty small / narrow and seating is limited. also, they only use disposable plates, utensils, and cups (that you grab yourself) I don't think it'd be that hard to use non-disposable ones? especially since most people eat inside the restaurant I feel. also, I wish they invested in good coffee and espresso drinks

Q0hCML8EI99yrFg5i5TdkA.text: This place is wonderful! Crepes can be made gluten feee, and you have options to fill with meats, veggies, and sweets! I had the chipotle chicken, and crepe was just so light and delicious, and the filling with chicken and salad was so fresh! Also tried the chicken basil, equally delicious. Food comes out pretty quick considering they make it fresh in front of you.   Plenty of room to sit inside and eat for groups of 4, and some tables outside. They use beepers to let you know when it's ready. Wish they had a place like this up in NY. Already want to go here again, try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beep me when my crepe is ready!
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu boards
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kitchen where the magic happens

VN09fQMa0i9Sf1XYSfNnlA.text: Great little creperie! My wife and I ate here for the first time on a Saturday morning at 8:30 after reading the excellent Yelp reviews and will definitely return. We split the Chevre & Mozz breakfast crepe for $8.75 (loaded with Egg, Mozzarella, Bacon, Mushrooms, Red Onion, Kalamata Olives & Goat Cheese) and the Berry Delight sweet crepe for $8.50 (Strawberries, Goat Cheese & Crushed Walnuts Drizzled With Honey, Topped With Powdered Sugar).   This salty and sweet combo was a perfect breakfast mix and the goat cheese on both was a highlight for us. (For those goat cheese haters/skeptics... just give it a try, I dare you!) Unlike other small creperies, this one has six creperie stones which ensured a quick delivery of our order. The crepes themselves are superb and the eclectic mic of ingredients are fresh nicely distributed. We were skeptical about the coffee but it also turned out to be quite good at $2.65 a cup.  Seating is a little tight but it's available inside and out. Atmosphere is simple but clean and attractive. The young crew that was working were focused on their job and were friendly. Sanitation score was a 98 and, being sticklers on the topic, we were pleased to witness them all to be very conscientious hand washers and glove wearers and off their cell phones (don't laugh, that last one has become very nasty, yet overlooked, problem.)  Although I rarely do this after only one visit, I can't find any reason not to give it 5 stars. I'm not quite ready to call it one of my Gotta Tries, but I'm close. That will depend on my next visit, which will be soon.   sweet crepe

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clean open kitchen.
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry crepe with goat cheese!
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chevre breakfast crepe.

M-dYve4H0bZG3whbMkFWBQ.text: Love this little gem of a place - and it's clearly a favorite for our little guy! Thanks for keeping it real and fresh -- we are huge fans!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

oSo60GnIodw2diK9HE0JgA.text: Absolutely delicious! My favorite crepe, is hands down the smores one! We had amazing service and our crepes were ready in minutes. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

ihlXLnZyPh3R6vi8bGyOOA.text: One of the best crepe locations in town.  It's worth the drive to hit all of their locations since some have items that the others don't.  The dessert crepe's certainly won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States

UxDcjHVpMdwoRUHtjY8Wmw.text: The crepe taste good by itself, nice employees, clean place, can be order lunch, or dessert or can even create ur own fast serving, taste delicious!

gTdPqqiquhEiME_DQVCp0g.text: Recently had a real desire for a dessert crepe - yelped to see what was near and decided on this location.  I had the strawberry/walnut/feta cheese crepe, which was quite good.  It was dusted with powdered sugar, but yet was not too sweet - possibly the addition of walnuts and feta cheese kept the balance.  Ate outside at one of the tables and had a nice relaxing break from the world.  Inside, it does feel a little like a fast food place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hazelnuts Creperie - Charlotte, NC, United States
